title: ‘Right drug at the right time holds the key in Covid management’
description:
PATNA
Right drug at the right time in the right measure holds the key in the treatment of Covid-19 and every effort should be made to discourage self-medication and prevent unnecessary panic-buying of drugs like Remdesivir and others, according to Dr Dr Neeraj Nischal, associate professor at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi

title: This image of a woman transporting an oxygen tank was taken in Bangladesh, not India
description: A photo has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows a Covid-19 patient in India transporting her own oxygen tank by motorcycle. The posts were shared as India's coronavirus infection rates soared to record levels, resulting in shortages of oxygen and hospital beds. The claim is false: the photo was taken in Bangladesh.

title: Bihar govt to set up 100 to 500 bed Covid care centre in each district of state in view of rise in Covid-19 cases

title: Bihar, Kerala, Chhattisgarh announce COVID-19 vaccine free of cost to all above 18 years of age

title: Bihar: 19 Covid Infected Juveniles Run Away from Hospital, 12 Traced
description: Out of 19 coronavirus positive inmates of a remand home who had escaped from the hospital isolation ward, 12 have been located and search is on for the others, Superintendent of Police Santosh Kumar said on Wednesday.

title: COVID19: Bihar Boy Rants Against Coronavirus with a Song
description:
Initially, COVID19 was a blessing in disguise for the school students, but now it's not anymore. This boy from Bihar's Chhapra expresses his complaint to Coronavirus in his viral song.
In the song, he asks the virus whether it is scared of elections or even goes on to advise it to visit West Bengal to take stock of the situation.
Do you agree with this young lad? Watch and let us know.
